description: Add and remove modules from the Linux Kernel

global_options.description: Print messages about what the program is doing
Read configuration from FILE instead of default /etc/modprobe.d
Dump the configuration file and exit
Do not actually insert or delete the module
Ignore install and remove commands in the configuration file
Do not complain about missing modules
Apply blacklist to module names too

type.data: find /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/kernel -name '*.ko*' 2>/dev/null | xargs -n1 basename 2>/dev/null | sed 's/\.ko.*$//' | sort -u | head -100
